Review: ong>An aromatically simple but pleasingly deep and pungent version of the Panama profile.

Name: El Salvador Finca Kilimanjaro

Name: Kenya AA Neguguini Estate
Review: ong>A darkish roast style helps both round and mute the Kenya fruit and flowers while developing weight and authority.

Name: Manzano Blend El Salvador
Review: ong>Those who find a slightly dry, astringent edge to sweet chocolate-leaning fruit bracing and invigorating.

Name: El Salvador Las Mercedes
Review: ong>A very light roast style develops the nut character of this classic El Salvador Bourbon. Moderate acidity, crisp fruit, and hint of flowers makes it an excellent candidate for those who take their breakfast cup black but who avoid aggressive acidity.

Name: Colombia Supremo

Name: Kenya AA Gatina
Review: ong>This coffee is "too sexy to just be friends," according to co-cupper Andy Newbom. Also presumably too good to just read about.

Name: El Salvador Los Planes Peaberry de la Lagunita
Review: ong>"Don't let this mouth party end," writes co-cupper Andy Newbom, which definitely sounds like a buy recommendation.

Name: Kenya AA Kiru
Review: ong>Crisply complex lighter roasted coffee with great character but smooth enough to please all palates.

Name: Costa Rica San Marcos Micro-Lot
Review: ong>Those who enjoy resolved complexity.

Name: Ka’u Bourbon
Review: ong>Everybody should but nobody can, given Lorie Obra only began separating fruit from her Bourbon trees near the end of the last harvest. We should have more next year. Nevertheless, a paradigm‑breaking experiment. This impeccably harvested and traditionally processed Hawaii Bourbon out-Kenya-ed most Kenyas.
Coffee Origin: Ka'u growing district, southwestern corner of the "Big Island" of Hawaii.

Name: Doi Chaang Wild Civet Coffee
Review: ong>Culinary adventurers who can afford the price of this exotic coffee and have tasted enough other coffees to appreciate its originality, an aroma/flavor complex both refreshingly pure yet richly suggestive of earth and decomposition.

Name: Kenya AA Lenana
Review: ong>Those who prefer understated grace to robust assertion.

Name: Mele 100% Kona Coffee
Review: ong>An exhilarating sensory riff on the Kona theme. For me enough excitement to compensate that one off-key bean.

Name: Kenya Peaberry Thika Gethumbwini
Review: ong>Strikingly complete expression of the great Kenya profile.

Name: Kenya Gititu Peaberry

Review: ong>Those who can easily imagine the smell of vanilla flowers.

Review: ong>A very dark-roast coffee that compensates for lean body with admirable complexity, including delicate but persistent floral top notes.

Name: Papua New Guinea
Review: ong>Those who love the scents of tropical mornings. The huge beans and a very light roast may in themselves interest aficionados.

Name: Papua New Guinea, Kuta Waghi Valley

Name: Kenya Gethumbwini

Name: Valley Heart Blend
Review: ong>Those who put a premium on richness and avoid aggressive acidity in a balanced, versatile cup.

Name: Spring Revival Blend
Review: ong>If spring means delicacy, meadow freshness and a clean sense of renewal, then this well-designed blend authentically fills expectations provoked by its name. I imagine spring is a particularly inspirational concept at Green Mountain, in the heart of the big-winter mountains of Vermont.

Name: Don Pepe Farm Panama

Review: ong>An elegantly floral wet-processed Yirgacheffe with impressive social and environmental credentials.

Name: Yemen Ameera

Name: Flor de Cauca Fair Trade Colombia Special Reserve
Review: ong>Those who sip beneath the surface.

Name: Cafe Kaldi
Review: ong>An interesting combination of floral and citrus delicacy and backgrounded pungent roastiness.

Name: El Corazon
Review: ong>Coffee adventurers. An interesting blend, low in acidity, big in body, and almost uncontrolled in its range of sensation.

Name: New York, New York
Review: ong>A resonant, deep cup sturdy enough to handle milk and sweetener.

Name: Tangletown Blend
Review: ong>Those who like crisp mornings and dry white wine.

Name: Private Reserve House Blend
Review: ong>Low-key adventurers.

Name: Our Blend
Review: ong>An L.L. Bean sort of coffee: no pretense, traditional style.

Name: This is My House! (coffee)
Review: ong>For those who buy by metaphor, a genuinely wild, outlawish coffee. For those who track through coffee types and origins, an excellent example of a coffee that uses a moderately dark roast to develop the rough beauty of what are probably one or two dry-processed or natural components.

Name: House Blend
Review: ong>Admirers of the subtle and graceful.

Name: Estate Blend
Review: ong>Those who enjoy unassuming complexity.

Name: Hominy Grill Blend
Review: ong>Unusual combination of acidy energy with expansive chocolate and aromatic wood notes.

Name: Fair Trade Organic House Blend
Review: ong>The socially and environmentally committed who don't want to give up on elegance.

Name: Romance by Paradise
Review: ong>Stylish adventurers who enjoy a powerfully but elegantly fruit-toned coffee.

Name: Rwanda Buf Coffee Mills
Review: ong>A fine variation on the East Africa profile: more balanced than many Yirgacheffes, less acidy than many Kenyas, a touch of chocolate, ultimately unique.

Name: Kenya Chania Northern Italian Roast
Review: ong>Those interested in experiencing the Kenya profile, so widely admired in drip and French press format, as a gently complex, elegant single-origin espresso.

Name: Bird Dog
Review: ong>A balanced, quietly complex espresso either as straight shot or in milk.

Name: Ethiopia Aleta Wondo
Review: ong>A quiet, deep version of the lemon-and-cocoa-toned Ethiopia wet-processed profile.

Name: Flores Organic
Review: ong>Those looking for quietly complex flavors in a relatively little-known origin.

Name: Wicked Winter Blend
Review: ong>Those who appreciate dark-roasted character and Fair Trade certification.

Name: Espresso (T Disc)
Review: ong>Perhaps the coffee in this T Disc was simply stale, since its main lack was absence of presence or character. Or perhaps the coffee was simply roasted too long and too dark. But if they all taste like this, I would not recommend these discs to an espresso drinker as a straight shot or even as component of a with-milk drink.

Name: Mastro Lorenzo Espresso (T Disc)
Review: ong>Tassimo owners who want to experiment with espresso. Among the three espresso-oriented T Discs we reviewed, the Mastro Lorenzo for us produced the most attractive espresso shot.

Name: Espresso (ESE pod)
Review: ong>With a fresher pod or a newer crop green coffee this Brazil may better express its potential for round body and complexly fruity chocolate.

Name: 100% Arabica, Black Label (ESE pod)
Review: ong>An attractive pod espresso for big milk drinks.

Name: GranCrema (ESE pod)
Review: ong>Those pod-brewer owners who enjoy classic everyday Italian lighter roasted, robusta-centered blends.

Name: Espresso Casa (ESE pod)
Review: ong>For those pod brewing folk who enjoy the lush side of the everyday Italian-style espresso. Hopefully another set of pods or a more compatible machine will net slower, better extracted shots.

Name: Capriccio Espresso Capsule (Green)
Review: ong>Capsule-committed espresso lovers who enjoy a rather bright, delicate straight shot.
Coffee Origin: Brazil, other South America origins, Central Africa.

Name: Espresso (ESE pod)
Review: ong>A bit tart and lean in the small cup, but complex in aromatics and expressively present in milk.

Name: Espresso (ESE pod)
Review: ong>A straight-shot espresso for those ESE-brewers who enjoy an espresso-ized version of a gently acidy, aromatically complex drip coffee.

Name: Arpessio Espresso Capsule (Purple)
Review: ong>Pungently sweet, deep-toned espresso for the Nespresso capsule-committed.
